intro: Rhinanthus alpinus var. lanceolatus, commonly known as the alpine common tickseed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is herbaceous, with slender, branched stems and lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in many areas.
